dct_description_sm: California shown as an unlabeled island with a very indented western coast.
Hemispheres are tilted at a 45 degree angle toward the center. Includes diagrams and figures surrounding the hemispheres.
Australia and Antartica are not mapped. North America is an unusual shape.
Folded. Bound after page 224 of text.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
